Reviews.Title: “Aalders”
Reviews.Author: vonBeavis
Reviews.Content: This place is the closest to best I've ever stayed at in Amsterdam. My room was on the ground floor, so no stairs or elevator; it was small but more than adequate for a solo traveler; it is on a quiet street a short walk from tram stops. They ask you to leave your key with the front desk, which helps security although a slight inconvenience, and the free wi-fi didn't really work too well but it was sufficient. Very nice staff, friendly and welcoming. Breakfast was good, typical booiled eggs, cheeses, meats, etc, with good coffee. I wish I'd found this place years ago.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Amsterdam - convenient location,Elevator and excellent breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: Elena A
Reviews.Content: Had a rest in the hotel Aaldres 14 to 18 April 2012. The room was a triple-in the room there were three beds, a wardrobe and a table with chairs. Still a lot of room for the passage of the room. Our room had a great balcony overlooking the garden, where Magnolia blossom! I can note the availability of the hotel Elevator. As in Ð�msterdam all the houses with steep spiral stairs - no Elevator, we would not have raised suitcases! Very natural vision the people at the front Desk - helped us navigate the map, answered all our questions. As always it was possible to ask for tea or water. Cleaning of the rooms and change of towels was carried out on a daily basis. Breakfast buffet on the basis of buffet - eggs, sandwiches, yoghurt, cereals, croissants. The hotel has Bicycle rental - from 3 hours. We took the bikes and rode around the city like a real townspeople))) The hotel itself is located very conveniently - it is quiet expensive district centre. Near bus stop and trams. By bus 197 can be reached directly from the airport to the hotel (approximately 20 minutes). Near the hotel there is the van Gogh Museum, the Vondelpark and the Rijkmuseum. If we once again come to Amsterdam, we will only stay in the hotel Ð�Ð°Ð»Ð´ÐµÑ€Ñ�!! Thank you to all the staff of the hotel for our excellent rest!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and quiet small family hotel near many museums”
Reviews.Author: JensenViborg
Reviews.Content: My wife, Karin, and I had a very nice weeend in Amsterdam thanks to the friendly staff of Hotel Aalders. The receptionist most of the days (friday to monday) was Alex who was very helpful and friendly. The breakfastroom was on some days small for the number of visitors and the breakfast was not very impressive, but the service an attendance was very good. We tsyed in room no. 11 on the forth foor which was a nice and quiet room with fine ventilation through the window and convenient furniture. We enjoyed our stay and would be happy to return to Aalders and rooom 11. Yours Kjeld Bjornager Jensen Professor emer. Viborg, Denmark

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: laoutlaw
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning of April. Hotel staff was pleasant and helpful upon check in, & suggested a place I could eat some lunch while waiting for room to be ready. Small single room was just that (small), and on the ground floor, but I expected that for Amsterdam. Room was serviceable but no frills, and sadly the walls (at least in my room) were a bit thin (noisy family in next door room could be heard coming & going). I had a door that opened up into a small back garden area. Location is a 3 minute walk from Hobbemastraat bus & tram stop, which is very convenient! The included breakfast is of the continental variety (no hot items) but was appreciated. Hotel was clean, and staff always available at desk, which is a plus. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Singap0reTraveller
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel as the original we wanted was fully booked. It was a good thing though! The location is fantastic, just a few steps away from the Van Gogh Museum and the shopping streets. The service was also excellent! Front desk staff were extremely helpful. Only gripe is that the rooms were too small, which is to be expected of most European hotels I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Amsterdam_Chris123
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is quietly located close to one major shopping street and to the Rijks and Rembrandt Museum. arriving at central station, one direct tram line takes you quite close to the hotel. In 5 minutes walking distance, you'll find one of Amsterdam's most famous bar area; the Leidseplein. However the rooms are small (as in all Amsterdam houses), staff is friendly and service more than OK. Bit on the expensive side but I'll recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “I'll come back!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa E
Reviews.Content: Wonderful quite central location on a calm street with beautiful acaccia trees. Got a nice room with a balcony at third floor and view over the green garden. Free wifi, wonderful staff and nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful option in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: anonymous096
Reviews.Content: Close to the museums, in a lovely neighborhood, the Aalders offers pleasant and reasonably spacious rooms at an excellent price. They also offer wonderful service: I left my cell phone in the room when I checked out. When I called the next day, they had found it, and several members of staff worked together to help me arrange for it to be picked up by Fedex and sent on to me in another country. It arrived, carefully wrapped the next day. I'll be sure to stay here again next time I'm in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Stay...Over priced.Very Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: BettyNYC
Reviews.Content: My family and i stayed for 5 days on Last April 2011. Small rooms,Its a 2 star hotel. Only good thing...location Dont go...rooms old, like Dracula rooms.We took the family one..2 double beds.. Very very small, no airconditioner, No ventilation or window on bath room, so we smell eveything. Its a Shop and go hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Melbourneboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and 6 other friends stayed at Hotel Aalders for three nights in September at the start of our European holiday. I had stayed in Amsterdam previously and was attracted to the location as it so close to everything you would want to see/do in Amsterdam. You may need to jump on a tram for some places but tram stops are nearby. The staff at Hotel Aalders were very friendly and helpful. I had some special needs for our stay and these were very helpfully looked after for us. The hotel is comfortable and the rooms are clean and functional. Beds were ok. Breakfast was also good in the European style. The hotel is not an upmarket place but if you are looking for value for money, friendly staff, convenient location and a nice neighbourhood then I believe Hotel Aalders provides that.

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: kazy2
Reviews.Content: this hotel is located in a quiet housing area and shopping street. very close to the museums, fondel park, leidse plein, it doesnt matter if it takes 30min walk to the central station but around this place,just perfect. and the room was clean, staffs are gentle and kind. free internet connection, but smoking free inside of the hotel. just a llittle expencive for my cheap demand holidays but i really like this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Great Location, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: tiamaria529
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Aalders for 3 nights in June, and we had a very pleasant stay. The staff was extremely helpful and helped make our stay in Amsterdam even more enjoyable. I thought the location of the hotel was perfect: It was a short walking distance to most attractions and restaurants but far enough away to get some peace and quiet at night. It is very close to the Van Gogh Museum. Our room seemed pretty big for European standards, but our bathroom was very small. The free breakfast was great. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A little tired but good staff and location”
Reviews.Author: mg788
Reviews.Content: Rooms and facilities are past their 'use by' dates. However this hotel is still worth considering due to its helpful, friendly staff and unbeatable location adjacent to the Rijksmuseum, ConcertGebouw and van Gogh Museum. Trams 2 & 5 bring you to near the hotel from the Central Train Station.

Reviews.Title: “Made my whole trip living hell”
Reviews.Author: teletubie
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here, this hotel is gonna steal as much maney as they can, and than if you ask any questions there gonna tell you that everything they feed extra was for smocking in your room, they costed me so much, that i spented 3 days on the street, trying to get bck home!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: patti4866
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Aalders after an eight day river cruise on the Rhine. This is an older European Hotel with atmosphere. The location made it convenient for us to walk everywhere in Amsterdam. The staff was friendly and the room clean. The rooms are small but there is a nice breakfast serviced each morning. We would stay at this hotel again if we are in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “clean and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: ScoutsG1
Reviews.Content: Good B&B. Clean rooms and friendly staff. Simple but delicious breakfast. Big room, cozy beds, big bathroom, good location (but not in the city center, you have to take the tram), located in the museum district (quiet and clean) Good place to stay, Booked last minute via Booking.com (great value) I'd stay there again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Bit far from the Center...”
Reviews.Author: freeport76
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel in the Museum area of the City, bit far from the main center (Dam Square) but conveniently connected by numerous trams and buses. Great Airport Stop just 2 min walk away. Rooms a bit old, bath completely refurnished. Breakfast ok. Kind staff. One only flaw: "strange" stains on a bed blanket...

Reviews.Title: “Room was very comfortable but small.”
Reviews.Author: gs8055
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in the Museum District part of Amsterdam. Although our room was a bit small, it was still very comfortable and clean. The breakfast was fantastic; as was all services provided. Note that the staff can arrange for discount tickets to almost all museums, canal trips, and attraction around Amsterdam. Hotel Aalders is located on a very quiet residential street, but close to good shopping and restaurants. The metro/tram stop is right around the corner, making it easy to get anywhere in Amsterdam. We, however, chose to walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Located In Museum/Shopping District”
Reviews.Author: TennesseeTravelQueen
Reviews.Content: This was an interesting little hotel. We reserved a quad room for 2 adults and 2 teenagers. The room had adequate space, but was very, very dated. It was a very old building which appeared to have been renovated in the 80's, but they were not very successful at combining old and new. It was, however, clean with comfortable beds and a decent morning breakfast. They had a bar in the lobby, but I think we were the only ones who wanted to use it and the night clerk (who is also the bartender) didn't seem very pleased that he had to wait on us. Interestingly enough, on the times we met him as he was getting off work he was a very pleasant fellow. I just don't think he liked his night job very much. Word of warning - we happened to be there when it was unusually hot and they do not have air conditioning. Do not rent the quad room if going in warm weather, the night clerk (when off duty) told us it was the hottest room in the hotel...he wasn't kidding. They gave us a fan to use, but since you can only open one of the windows in this room it never really cooled down that much. All in all, I would stay here again if the weather was cool. I really liked being close to the museums (all within a few blocks) and high end shopping. It was also very easy to access the rest of Amsterdam via bus or water taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in posh Amsterdam Museum District”
Reviews.Author: Mithri123
Reviews.Content: The stuff at the Hotel it's very friendly, helpful. Location is excellent in the expencive area of Museum district very central easy to get to and come back at night, safe area you can get n tram 5 from central station to get to the hotel. Breakfast room was very nice, food standard breakfast food stuff helpful. Room very clean with flat screen tv over looking back garden got to say it was noisy from the room you can hear other people going up and down the stairs which I found annoying and the bed needs up grading, I used ear plugs and then was fine. Room small but in central Amsterdam it's normal. Room next to mine nice big double room and I am sure much more quite. You can keep bike in the garden at the back. wish they had alternative milk soya based at breakfast and soya yogurt & porridge. Stuff: 5 Room:3 Location:5 Breakfast:3 Cleanliness:5 Noise:2

Reviews.Title: “A Proper Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobNIkAmslon
Reviews.Content: What do I mean, well simple really, Straight up, no fuss honest as the day as is long type of hotel, NO gimmicks, no Rubbish. Ie Boutique Hotels or the Big hotels with 500 +plus rooms.Always helps when you get upgraded upon arrival,I had booked a extra small but got a single, probably biggest single in Amsterdam and I have a been in some small rooms. For me a hotel is somewhere to sleep, could care less about details esp on weekend break. All I want is Clean room, TV, shower,fresh, friendly staff, come and go as you want, security over belongings and the Aalders delievered. Simple really stay here. and when you factored in Breakfast, city taxes, at 95 per night @height of the season, I can wear that too. Thanks Aalders.,...

Reviews.Title: “Charming museum district hotel.”
Reviews.Author: InMetrospect
Reviews.Content: Excellent, safe location on a quiet, tree-lined street just steps from Amsterdam's most famous museums and minutes walking distance to most of the city's other cultural squares, sites and neighbouring hotspots. Situated just out of the canal ring, Aalders is a perfect home base for exploring Amsterdam on foot, or taking advantage of public transit with convenient stops just steps away from the hotel. I stayed in the small single room on the top floor. Exactly as advertised on their website, so don't be surprised by its compact size. It is tiny, with almost a dorm-like quality to it. Except for the flat panel, the dÃ©cor is very dated, making the room look unkempt. The bathroom needs a makeover. Housekeeping is average. And the walls are incredibly thin so be prepared to hear your neighbours' conversations, what they're watching on t.v., and their bathroom activities (and vice versa, I presume.) Poor drainage in the shower and the hot water was unstable at times. Depending on your level of expectation, you'll either be very disappointed, or you'll tolerate the room's quirks and get on with your city stay (recommended). Of the positives: Aalders is cozy and actually quite charming in spite of its shortcomings. The breakfast room was pretty, and the breakfast itself was plentiful and of good variety. Special thanks to all the staff here. They are fabulous! Friendly. Knowledgeable. Helpful. And kind. I will return. And would recommend this hotel to other solo travellers looking for safe, acceptable, no-fuss accommodations when visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Pamalcorn
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel, a stones throw from the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh museum. Bus from the airport comes right to the Rijksmuseum and it's easily walkable from there. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, spoke perfect English, and were happy to provide advice and directions about restaurants, transport etc. We stayed in a family room, just large enough for four (2 boys under 12), clean and comfortable if a little bit dated. It's on the expensive side - a good bit more than equivalent hotels we stayed at in Munich and Innsbruck - but so is everywhere in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place in Perfect Spot”
Reviews.Author: MacVespa
Reviews.Content: Peaceful, clean & kind. Great location and best breakfast. Helpful staff and easy walk to tram to see the entire city. Love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: larainotterton
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely family run hotel in the upmarket Museum Quarter of Amsterdam. Within easy reach of all the attractiions and a short walk from the Van Gogh museum etc, it really is ideally placed. Considering it's so central, it's also very quiet and peaceful, some of the rooms have balconies over the garden. The staff are friendly and helpful, rooms were clean and spacious, breakfast was a good choice and plenty of it in the attractive dining room. Free internet access in the cosy little bar. The only improvement I could think of would be tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms. Thanks for a lovely stay!

Reviews.Title: “great family hotel, greaty location close to the park”
Reviews.Author: donckd
Reviews.Content: I Looked everywhere for a family friendly hotel and Here it is, They were able to put up to 4 beds in one room and it still felt like we could walk around, rooms are simple and clean and full baths . Breakfast was great and we loved the location, close to everything on a quite street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Will recommend anyday!”
Reviews.Author: Narad
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after an internet search and was a little scared how it would turn out. Turned out to be an excellent choice. Great location, good transport connections, quiet street, Museums next door. Helpful friendly staff. Wi-fi.Despite some noisy Americans in the next room, could manage a decent night's sleep. :) Will return unhesitatingly whenever next in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel, good location. Recommended”
Reviews.Author: canihavearewind
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam, like any capital city, appears to be quite an expensive place to stay. Hotel Aalders offers a relatively cheap and perfectly agreeable option. It is set one block from the Museumplein in a very nice tree lined street. It is an easy walk into central Amsterdam and perfectly situated for public transport links, whilst enjoying the benefit of being in a relaxed neighbourhood with good restaurants and cafe/bars. We really enjoyed our stay here and it acted as a perfect base for exploring the City. Further on the plus side, the staff were friendly and polite and there is a 24 hour reception from where you can book tours and there are bikes to rent from right outside the hotel. The breakfast is nice and the hotel very clean. Slightly on the down side, the decor is a little dated (if that bothers you). It is not a "boutique" hotel by any stretch of the imagination but then you are not paying boutique prices and it does have a certain charm. The bathrooms are also perfectly good (clean and with new showers etc). Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Italy008
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this very European hotel. The quiet street that was near public transportation and any action one might want; the gorgeous room on the 4th floor above the tree tops; the friendly, helpful staff who were always available; the delightful breakfast in a beautiful room. We can't recommend this hotel enough. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: SinatraFans
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Aalders for 4 nights in May and we would definitly stay there again. Only a 5 minute walk from the Van Gogh Museum and the Rijksmuseum, it was the perfect location for us. The street it is in is quiet yet you are only 1 Tram stop away from Leidseplein which is an area full of bars, clubs and cafes. The number 2 or 5 Tram both stop at the end of the street and bring you to Dam Square, and Central Station. The Hotel is clean and the staff could not be more helpful. Our room was lovely, looking out over the garden, we even had a balcony. Breakfast was more than adequate - Cereals, Boiled Eggs, Cold Meats, Cheeses, Bread, croissants and fruit. If you are looking for an old fashioned, friendly, family run hotel in a great location then this is the place for you! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, quiet.”
Reviews.Author: amatthews2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel is expensive, but every hotel in Amsterdam is expensive, and I'd bet most are not as nice as the Hotel Aalders. This hotel is walkable to the Rijksmuseum and the van Gogh Museum, and only a block away from the 2 and 5 trams which will take you to the more lively parts of the city. The staff was very nice, and willing to answer the many questions we had. The hotel is on a quiet street, so we could get a good night's sleep. The only complaint: the pillows were very uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended for short or longer stays.”
Reviews.Author: zenthyme
Reviews.Content: Small European hotel in a fantastic location, clean & simple rooms, very decent breakfast, very helpful staff. Near Van Gogh Museum, Rijksmuseum, canal boat stops; quiet street, Breakfast rooms in front and back -- back with view of magnificent magnolia, flowering in April. Elevator (fortunately, because stairs are steep and narrow), narrow corridors. Bike rental. We hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: MaggieS1
Reviews.Content: The Aalders is a typical European hotel, nothing too flash, but good service and a fantastic location near Vondel Park, Leidseplein and the Rijks museum. You can easily walk to all of these attractions within a few minutes and it's a great place if you take your jogging seriously!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: gailmay
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the hotel Aalders was only for 2 nights but we would definitely return due to its convenience. My husband & I had a double room - the only problem was that there was not enough room between the bed, the door & the wall to get our suitcases in so they had to be lifted (each one weighed about 22kg so was not an easy feat) over the end of the bed. However, the shower was hot & water pressure good - which counts for a lot. My sister's room was upgraded by the hotel on their own volition on checkin - her room was very large with oodles of room. One interesting feature was the fake chest of drawers. The downstairs coffeeshop/bar area was pleasant & the prices fair. Breakfast was good - but don't expect bacon & eggs, sausages etc. On offer were boiled eggs, pastries, bread for toast, cereals, cheeses, meats, juice & tea or coffee. The staff were very helpful & nothing was too much trouble. As we were lesving for a 2 week river cruise, we had the hotel order us a taxi to take us to the embarkation point. When we reached the wharf, the boat was not there & noone on any of the other boats knew where it was. However, out intrepid taxi driver dropped us off & then went searching for the boat, finding it on the other side of the river. he then came back & picked us up. The cruise company had not updated the website so the wrong embarkation point was listed. If all Amsterdam taxi drivers were like this one, then everyone would be smiling. All in all, the hotel staff were friendly & helpful. One of the sons was serving in the bar on one of the nights & was very friendly & chatty.

Reviews.Title: “best choice :)”
Reviews.Author: little_masi
Reviews.Content: excellent choice of the hotel, friendly stuff, clean rooms but small (if you are staying for a short time...you nevermind :)), delicious breakfast, very good location - close to everywhere - only few minutes to rijksmuseum and van gogh museum, approx. 10 minutes by walk to city centre...i really recommend :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, rooms are basic but they do the job”
Reviews.Author: JO1984_10
Reviews.Content: My partner and myself stayed at this hotel whilst visiting Amsterdam. The hotel rooms are pretty small and basic, but they do the job. The staff are very friendly and the building has lots of character. The thing we loved the most about this hotel was the location...amazing spot. Removed from the seediness of the Red Light District (but all that is still a picturesque walk away) and in the beautiful museum district. Hiring bikes is easy and a must when you're in Amsterdam, and there's a beautiful park nearby that is worth a ride around.

Reviews.Title: “It OK”
Reviews.Author: AirTrafficMan
Reviews.Content: Yep, the location is fantastic and the included breakfast makes the hotel a good buy. I booked the "smallest single room" in the house and whoaaaa, it was about 8ft X 8ft. You had to literally step over the single bed to get into the bathroom. Kind of felt like I was on a cruise ship!! It was clean and the folks were extremely nice.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, adorable, little hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlphaScorpii
Reviews.Content: Ok, the hotel is not your typical, chain hotel. It's family run, with a specific look to it (my friends told me, when they saw my pictures, that it looked like a museum :)). I was looking for a hotel in Amsterdam that will have a room for three people as I was traveling with my family. Also, not too expensive and decent location. And that's how I found this place. And I loved it! First of all, location is great. It is close to many museums, fashion district, restaurants, bars. Amsterdam, as a whole, is not that big of a city so we walked everywhere and used the public transportation on our last day only-going to to the Central Station to catch a train to Schiphol. Yet, the street is very quiet, residential. Second, the look and feel is so different. Like I said, it felt almost like you were staying in a museum :) Bathroom was updated, very new, modern and clean (if not very big, but I don't care about it). Complementary breakfast was nice. Nothing special, but it's good to have a meal to eat before you head out exploring the city. Complementary wifi is something that is very precious to me, very important-so loved that as well. Third, people are very nice. I got to notice that after I left (I don't interact much with people who work at hotels etc and consider myself extremely low maintenance). What happened is that I forgot my outlet adapter and my iphone charger. They send me an email before I even arrived back to the States to let me know and asked me if I want them to send it to me. They charged my credit card off course, but their attitude and personal service felt so genuine. BTW, I tend to forgot my chargers everywhere I go but never ever any hotel tried to let me know or send me stuff. Overall, I recommend this hotel very much!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but noisy and tiny rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Agent5
Reviews.Content: Not sure why this hotel is getting such great reviews on here. It is undoubtedly a phenomenal location, but it was was very noisy and the rooms are very small (we had three rooms and all were tiny). The pictures on the website are very deceiving and the hotel can definitely benefit from some updating. However, the staff was great - very nice and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated â€“ you could do a lot better in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Ray_28
Reviews.Content: I donâ€™t understand how this hotel got so highly rated here. I booked a room for two nights here and when I checked in I was shocked by the standard of the room. It was located on the first floor â€“ up the stairway on the right side. It was damp and hot and smelled like detergent. The tiny bathroom is basically located within a closet inside the room and reeked of washing detergent. The room also had a small window which did not open or let in much sunlight. I felt completely claustrophobic in that room and the hotel did not have any other room available. I canceled my booking and moved to Fital hotel which is next door. That hotel is a lot better with brighter airier rooms.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Silvana_Rio
Reviews.Content: I spent a few days in Amsterdan last january with my 17years old daughter and we had a wonderful time! We stay at Hotel Aalders and everything about the hotel was great: the big family room, breakfast, location and staff. The Hotel has a home atmosphere, is very clean,very friendly and is close enough to most atractions. the staff helps you in every question. We would definitely stay there again. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: abstr
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located very closely to the Rijksmuseum. It is also in 10 min walking distance from Leidseplein, a popular tourist destination. Despite being located in "car-enabled" part of the city, it is still very quiet, as the street is almost unused by automobiles, and no party-going noise is being heard. I was staying in "the smallest room", which is really very small, but that's what I've expected to get from the hotel where I would stay only for several hours at night: Amsterdam is not a ctiy where you'd like to spend all your time watching TV. Complimentary breakfast was simple and good, with pastries, cheeses and juices (muesli was also available). Sleep quality wasn't good though, but it was solely my fault: I've missed to reduce heat level on the heater before going to sleep, and so it was too warm out there. That also means that room should be comfortable even during cold winters. Staff was good and friendly. And even if you are coming back to your room late at night, you can get a cup of hot tea at the bar which is part of the hotel. I'll definitely consider visiting this place again.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel! (Solo Female Traveller)”
Reviews.Author: MissB_2010
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel and would definitely stay here again. I booked the small single room and absolutely fell in love with it! It was super cute â€“ the perfect size for me. Loads of room for storing luggage and clothes. The bathroom was small, but adequate. The bed was comfortable and the room was very clean. The windows opened outwards onto a beautiful street scene, I just had to climb out and sit on the ledge! This is a very cosy hotel with a lovely friendly feel. Staff were helpful. Breakfast was a great start to the day (especially the yummy fruit shots). The location is excellent - right around the corner from Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum on a quiet street near the most expensive street in Amsterdam P.C. Hooftstreet (great for window shopping!) Tram stops are nearby, but itâ€™s an easy and picturesque walk into the centre of town. I was a solo female traveller and this was my first time in Amsterdam. I would definitely stay at Hotel Aalders again and would recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “2 cold but beatiful days in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: plexxiify
Reviews.Content: this little hotel centered in the museum and fashion district has charme. u can reach nearly every point of interest within a few minutes. the tram stations are right around the corner. i canÂ´t say anything about the breakfast, except that it smelled really good, cause we spent the time till check out in bed. if u donÂ´t need it too posh and wanna save your money for shopping or a nice meal, this would be the hotel of your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: n_zilber
Reviews.Content: I booked this wonderful hotel couple weeks before our short weekend trip to Amsterdam. The reviews helped me to make right choice. Thank you, to all who wrote them.. Location was definitely ideal, staff friendly and helpful, breakfast very good, room nice and clean. We arrived to Amsterdam with rather early flight, and were very happy to get our room at 10 in the morning. We asked about it making the reservation, and they wrote us, that they will try to arrange it, but can't guarantee. Anyway we got it, and were very happy. Another nice thing was -*how to get* instruction. Next time in Amsterdam I will stay at Aalders for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: FongGa
Reviews.Content: Great location in a quiet street near to a tram stop. Also close to main museums and a wonderful park. Accommodation was satisfactory; dÃ©cor was a bit dated and room a bit small but it was comfortable. Breakfast was fine, enough to keep you going until lunchtime. Free wifi. Friendly and helpful reception staff. Good value. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, FRIENDLY STAFF, ROOMS NEED URGENT UPDATING”
Reviews.Author: StarLady99
Reviews.Content: Hotel Aalders is located in a wonderful location within easy walking distance of the Rijks , Van Gogh, and Stedylik museums as well as the Concert Hall and Bols Genever Experience. Fashionable shops are within the block. The staff are helpful and the continental breakfast is satisfying, served in a lovely dining room with excellent coffee and steamed milk. Bicycles are available to rent outside the front door. The great disappointment was the bedroom which was excruciatingly small and very shabby. Two small beds were pushed together, both mattresses were very uncomfortable, and there was just a hook to serve as a closet. Being 2 people with 2 suitcases, we couldn't open our suitcase and walk. The bathroom was very tiny as were the towels, but the shower had wonderful pressure and hot water. We were on the 4th floor/street side (canals are 2 blocks away) which was fairly quiet with the windows closed. There is an elevator (very slow, yet welcome) which is a bonus in this city. Many boutique hotels in Amsterdam were former houses and rooms tend to be small, however, as a seasoned traveler, this room was suited for one person only and , although clean, was in dire need of updating/remodeling. Since we had a jammed schedule, we didn't remain in the room much except to sleep. If you are planning a romantic get away or want to really rest, this would not be a good choice for the reasons stated above. There is no wifi throughout the hotel, although a public computer is located in the bar and its use is complimentary to guests. The way the screen is mounted, it's difficult to use and everyone can see what you are doing. It will be a much better hotel when the owners remodel and enlarge the rooms, replace the worn out mattresses, and update the decor. As it is, it feels like a place for backpackers and I could only recommend it to people who don't care about the quality of the bedrooms. Unfortunately our friends want bigger, more comfortable accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding quality and perfect position.”
Reviews.Author: wingfield52
Reviews.Content: Hotel Aalders was a great find. Perfect and tranquil location. The Museumplein was on the corner, as were the trams which gave access to all the other attractions. We had a medium twin room and it would have passed for large in a lot of places. The beds were comfortable and everything was spotless. Although there was not tea making in the room we did have bottled water and tea was available in the bar area all day. The staff at the hotel were very attentive, friendly and helpful including an all night reception. The dining room was very pretty and roomy compared to most hotels, the breakfast was plentiful and tasty. Particularly pleased with the variety of breads and teas. I would recommend Hotel Aalders to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel in Nice Amsterdam Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: geehouse19
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a nice neighborhood close to the Museumplein. Our 4-person room was rather large, roomy, and comfortable. The breakfast that was offered was pretty standard, and the hotel staff was quite friendly & helpful. The only thing keeping my rating in the "average" category instead of the "above average" category was the fact the room would sometimes smell a little musty. This is a decent option if you are looking for a nice hotel in the Museumplein area.

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: GlobalsailorLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on our way to another town in the Netherlands. The hotel was made from two old town houses and was clean and the room excellent, with a modern bathroom. The staff was particularly helpful, ordering a ticket for the premier of an opera. The hotel is 150 metres from the Rijksmuseum and the same distance from th Number 2 and 5 trams from Central Station. There is a free internet PC in the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive staff, (mostly) comfortable beds, great location!”
Reviews.Author: NorthwestGeek
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Aalders for a one-night layover on our way back from a trip to Germany. The hotel is located near the Museumsplein, and in addition to the museums there's lots of other things to do/see/eat nearby, and there's a grocery store within a five minute walk (nice for that last-day-of-holiday bottle of wine). We were in room #25, which is a large triple room that has a very nice balcony overlooking the green space between the buildings - we arrived in the afternoon, and it was great to sit out on the balcony with a glass of wine and listen to the kids play at the nearby school. The room itself was great and the beds were generally pretty comfortable, although the larger bed is made up of two double beds pushed together so sleeping in the middle of the bed is pretty much out of the question. For what seemed like a pretty reasonable rate for Amsterdam, I'm very happy with the hotel and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly staff and very clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: rlogue
Reviews.Content: Hotel Aalders is very well located almost next to the Rijksmuseum, Leidseplein and the Van Gogh museum. It's a few minutes walk from the excellent Pijp district for relaxed bars and restaurants as well. But what makes the Hotel Aalders stand out is its exceptional value, clean rooms and friendly staff. My friends and I were made very welcome and I fully intend to stay at the Aalders next time I'm in Amsterdam. The rooms aren't big but you pay a fair and low price for them but most importantly they are clean and I had two very good nights sleep there followed by an excellent Dutch breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: robin02907
Reviews.Content: It was our first time traveling in Europe and we weren't sure what to expect, but we were very pleased with our stay at Hotel Aalders. Our room was very clean, quiet at night, and the staff was very pleasant and helpful. The breakfast (included) was more than adequate, and the breakfast room area was quite lovely. The location was great, on a quiet street near the museums and easy walking to restaurants in the area. We stayed three nights and wished that we could've stayed longer (due to the hotel being booked up). We spent three additional nights at another Amsterdam hotel, which were disappointing after our Hotel Aalders experience. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “acceptable in a very nice neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: TonyFNewZealand
Reviews.Content: price wise- a little on the steep side but so is most of Amsterdam. location- superb in the museumplein. close enough to the action, museum, concert hall, trams but quiet at night. reception- mostly friendly. one male receptionist was a little on the cold side but this is not Italy either. room- good enough, clean enough, acceptable size as we are in Amsterdam. security- felt very secure the whole time. breakfast- very nice service, very nice room, good enough buffet breakfast. will i stay there again? yes.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunately would not recommend - Room Very Smelly”
Reviews.Author: ktrimmer
Reviews.Content: Just returnded from staying at the Aalders Hotel, on the plus the breakfast was nice most staff helpful, location good, however the parking was not the easiest but the worst was the smell of the room. We reported it a few times and because we arrived at 9pm and with another family, the hotel was full and could not change rooms. They tried to clean it by apparently changing the shower curtain, but no luck. We thought the smell would go with the windows open, again no luck. It was like smelly socks/ wet dog/body odor. When we asked at checkout for a reduction, we were told by a very abrupt unhelpful female manager if it were her she would have gone somewhere else, but did offer 10E reduction per night. We booked this based on feedback from the trip advisor, it is worth noting our friends room did not smell. It is unfortunate but with a smelly room and unhelpful manager I would definately not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Father/Daughter Short Trip”
Reviews.Author: spirot69
Reviews.Content: After I had read almost all reviews here, I decided to reserve a room in Aalder's for my two days trip to Amsterdam with my liitle daughter, who was really interested to visit the Van Gogh Museum. The location of the hotel is ideal (close to museums) and very safe. We choosed the small twin room, which was really small (especially the bathroom) but exactly what expected to be. It is a family run hotel, clean and tidy, that offers decent accommodation in good prices. The breakfast was adequate and served in an exceptionally nice room. The front rooms are more noisy especially in weekdays.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent little hotel in the perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: George_Cantstanza
Reviews.Content: As a frequent visitor to Amsterdam, I've stayed in plenty of the city's hotels and this ranks amongst the very best in terms of overall value and service. It's also in my favourite location within the city - between the museumplein and vondelpark, yet a short walk to Leidseplein and the rest of the canal belt. I'm not going to post reviews of all the hotels I've stayed in over the years (prior to becoming a trip advisor contributor) but I'll make an exception for Hotel Aalders because my last stay there was less than a year ago, and because I keep passing the hotel on foot or on cycle (while staying at other hotels in the museumplein / vondelpark areas) since it's on such a nice, quiet perfectly-situated street. The rooms are well maintained, the service very professional and the hotel provides almost everything you need from a small family run hotel, such as free wifi (plus a computer for your use in the small bar room next to reception) and a decent breakfast. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: canadianfamily46
Reviews.Content: good location for family. nice neighbourhood. room for four was comfortable and a good size. close to Van Gogh museum but a bit of a walk to downtown. No air conditioning, but a big window that opened and a small fan.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: davebPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: We stayed six nights, arriving tired and cranky from having to drag our suitcase more than a mile. We arrived the afternoon town was shut down to celebrate second place finish in World Cup. [How long would the celebration have gone on if Netherlands had won the cup?] The hotel was a welcome sight, the end of our trek. But more, day after day it was wonderfully positioned to museums, concert hall, parks, easy access by public transportation to everywhere beyond walking distance. Staff were very helpful in directing us how to access trams and buses. Lovely breakfast room, garden side preferred. The substantial cold buffet breakfast, with a sandwich taken out, gave us a good start on the day. The small room was not air-conditioned, but fan and an open window made it quite comfortable. Amazingly quiet. Two comfortable twin beds pushed together made a decent approximation of a king bed.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: TravelJournaler56
Reviews.Content: We were traveling on a budget, which is why we chose this hotel. And after checking out the reviews on Trip Advisor, we figured we knew what we were getting: a great location, a small, no-frills room, and a decent free breakfast. All of which were true. However, we hadn't planned on a heat wave and hadn't realized the hotel didn't have air-conditioning. Yikes. While the front desk did provide a small table fan, it really didn't help cool down the stuffy room. Our solution was to leave the hotel right after breakfast, and not return until 10 pm. Even then we had to sleep with the window open, but luckily the hotel is in a quiet area, and we didn't have any problem with street noise keeping us awake. We thought about switching hotels, but after checking with the other hotels on the street, we found they didn't have AC either. On the plus side, the hotel is in a fabulous location for museum hopping and near several tram stops. The hotel staff was very courteous, and we had no problem with the free wi-fi. Also the breakfast was substantial and served in a beautiful room, and they even provided an early breakfast for us on our departure day. We would definitely stay in the hotel again, but not in the hot summer months.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay - will stay here again next time we're in A'dam”
Reviews.Author: TeaandTravel
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights in Room No. 9. I had heard that rooms in Amsterdam are small but we were pleasantly surprised by the size of this room. The wood-paneled walls gave the room a very warm feel. The bathroom looked recently renovated and was spacious. The breakfast room was lovely, service was very friendly and selection was good. The location was great: quiet but very close to the bus stop (lines 2 and 5 both go to the Centraal Station), Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum, in one direction, the Vondel Park in the other direction where my husband ran every morning, and the Leidseplein with its restaurants and cafes was only 5 minutes away. The taxi ride from the airport was about 35 euros and well worth it. It would be very hard to get onto the train and bus with a suitcase. We were able to leave our suitcases at the reception the morning we arrived until we could get into our room later on. It was great to have an elevator in the hotel. The only negative was that we were on the third floor and it was warm at night without air conditioning. Fortunately there was a fan which helped. This should not be a problem unless you go there in the middle of the summer. The windows open wide. We will definitely come back the next time we stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Run Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel200855
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Hotel Aalders in June. The location was perfect for us on a quiet tree lined street very near the museums but just a few minutes walk from the VondelPark and the Liedseplein. It is well away from the seedier side of Amsterdam which is what we wanted. The Hotel is Small and is Family Run. As a family of four we stayed in the Family Room which was a decent size room, large enough for a family of 4 plus luggage. The hotel offered free wireless which worked great as well as providing a very nice breakfast each morning (included in the price). The staff of the hotel were all very accomodating as well helpful with directions or calling a cab for us to return to the airport. Next time in Amsterdam will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “We all enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Aalders which made our visit to Amsterdam all the more memorable.”
Reviews.Author: Muirly
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and convenient and the staff were very helpful. We found the room to be small for four adults but this did not negatively affect our stay or our enjoyment of the hotel. The location of the hotel was great for us and we were able to navigate the city with little effort.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable quiet hotel, perfectly located, with friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Rodney_10
Reviews.Content: An intended short stay here became much longer because of the ash cloud. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff, who were helpful, friendly and understanding. A lovely, family hotel, a million miles from the formulaic standard hotel chains. Quiet, safe and relaxing: I would certainly stay here again the next time I visit Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Great little find”
Reviews.Author: AMB01
Reviews.Content: Generally hotels in Amsterdam seem to be quite pricey. This one was reasonably priced and included a very good breakfast. All hotel staff friendly and helpful. Room was small (but that is what we expected as was classed as a "small twin") but perfectly adequate, quiet and clean. Shower was very large for such a small room. Street very quiet away for hussle and bussle of Amsterdam. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good value family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grandmajoy
Reviews.Content: I am a fairly frequent visitor to Amsterdam, and have previously been unhappy about the high prices/small rooms/indifferent service offered. On the basis of one night's stay, I think this might be an exception. In a quiet road in the museum district, easily reached on Tram 2 from the Centraal Station, it is friendly, meticulously clean, offers an interesting breakfast in a room with a charming view of gardens, and all for under â‚¬100 a night including breakfast. My room was of tolerable size, was quiet, and had good , user-friendly lighting ( a key test, in my view). I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: Giddes
Reviews.Content: Hotel Aalders is not fancy, but it is a good choice for touring Amsterdam. The location is ideal, a short walk to the major museums in one direction and a street away from Amsterdam' s version of Rodeo Drive in the other direction. It is on a quiet street between these two major attractions. It's also close to public transportation. The breakfast was good with the typical breads, meat cheese, and cereals, and the staff were attentive in offering drinks and keeping the food fresh. The hot chocolate was wonderful! The desk staff were also friendly and helpful beyond our experience in other hotels. Internet access was easy, but in the bar, so no privacy. Our single rooms on the first floor were very small and close to the service closet and staff bathroom, so noisy at times. Hotel Aalders does not have any frills, but is in a good location and the service is great. I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again, but ask for a room on the upper floors.

Reviews.Title: “best location for art lovers, friendly small hotel”
Reviews.Author: j_mendelssohn
Reviews.Content: My room was small (but they'd told me that in advance). But it backed onto a grassy courtyard, and had good light. Very friendly staff (OK it's a family business) and free Wi-fi was much appreciated. This is a block behind the Van Gogh Museum, in the same street as the Rijksmuseum. They do have a supply of yellow bikes outside for riders. Ideal for art lovers. Wild party types would hate it, but that's not their target audience

Reviews.Title: “Ok, not great”
Reviews.Author: RainerMaria
Reviews.Content: Aalders hotel is ok, but not as great as one might think reading the other reviews. The location is excellent, very quiet, close to museums and luxury shopping, and about 20-30 minutes on foot from the centre through a beautiful park (or less than10 minutes by taxi or tram, tram stop nearby). The rooms with a garden view are totally quiet. The beds are ok, but not great. Bathrooms are tiny but sufficient. Some of the furniture is quite cheap which is a pity given the beauty of the building - e.g. the design of the chairs in the main breakfeast room is appalling. The hotel is very clean. Breakfast is bad - not varied, the quality of the food is inferior. Very good and personalized service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Shepherdess01
Reviews.Content: I had along walk from the plane to find the shuttle bus at Schiphol Airport but after getting stuck in traffic, arrived at hotel Aalders safely. Expensive area of Amsterdam with lovely 1900s buildings which enchanted me - my favorite period of architecture. The welcome at the hotel was great, truly friendly, the room and bed good and directions where to eat excellent. After a good meal near the Concertgebouw I had a good night's sleep and a great array of food on offer for breakfast next morning. Next day I set off for the Rijksmuseum which is 2 minutes away. Pay to go in and find Rembrandts in number and other Dutch painters. Don't forget the Rembrandthuis Museum, truly interesting and the Museum Van Loon which is a beautiful house with beautiful contents - he founded the east India Company. There are many other things to see but I wished to see painting and I had to take into account the Rijksmuseum is partly closed for renovation. Took in a short lunchtime concert (Concertgebouw Orchestra) at the Concertgebouw (5 minutes away). Found a super food market, underground,across the road from the concert building, to get some supper (breakfast only at hotel) for after evening concert. Concert was what I had come for really and it was brilliant. Fantastic orchestra. There is classical music each evening, varying orchestras, and the Concertgebouw has a cafe and, before performances, two bars. Next day I wandered around the city which is so picturesque and full of interesting museums and small shops - a street devoted to antiques which is great, as are the buildings they are in. Canals and boats are great and a photo opportunity at every step, provided you look out for bikes, seemingly on every inch!! Plenty of places to eat, small and larger (plenty of ham and cheese too!). Try the pancakes - wow! A canal trip is a must. The hotel arranged a ticket for me and it was really worth the reduction I got and the trip was fascinating. The commentary is spoken in Dutch and English and French, so you do not miss anything and it does not interfere with your enjoyment. Photo opportunities again, either at the open rear of the boat or by opening a window and photographing through. After hours of walking each day I was ready for food, lovely, friendly Italian place nearby and an Indonesian also. The hotel staff are brilliant, so pleasant and informative. I would certainly recommend anyone to stay there. It is reasonable and within easy walking distance of famous museums, etc. and the city itself. There are trams on a very regular basis to get across town should you wish, two/three minutes away at the end off the street near the Rijksmuseum. For a rest there is the nearby park and for Bond Street type shopping there is the next street. All in all a great stay and a very nice small hotel with a very nice lot of people working there and staying there. Well recommended. Remember though that there is a great deal of walking and on brick pavers, and around the churches, cobbles, so wear sensible shoes - be attractive, I did not see many pairs of trainers! Dress smartly for concerts and larger restaurants. Advice - taxis are expensive, especially from the airport; get a return shuttlebus ticket. Cannot arrange to go to your hotel until t get on the bus and explain where wish to go and it will be done. Can arrange a pick-up to airport from hotel. I was lucky - no bus available so had a taxi at the same cost and was at the airport far faster than anticipated. A must see city and a must stay at hotel, couples or solo.

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Temple84
Reviews.Content: We have been living outside Amsterdam for four months, since February, and traveling into the city regularly. We discovered the Aalders on our second visit, and it became our hotel of choice thereafter.It is ideally located for our purposes, the rooms were clean, comfortable, and well-priced, and the staff (with a special nod to Rick) invariably welcoming ,cheerful, and extremely helpful. We look forward to returning to Amsterdam and the Aalders, when the renovations to the Rijksmuseum and the Stedelijk Museum are complete.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, clean, great location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: nancymcardle
Reviews.Content: My aunt and I stayed at Hotel Aalders for 4 nights, in 2 of the small single rooms. We both thought the rooms were large enough, very clean with private baths and TVs. Mine overlooked the quiet street and hers opened onto a lovely garden. All the staff were extremely helpful and kind. It was wonderful that we could check in early after a long flight. The breakfast room is very nice and the included breakfast is good. Very convenient to the museums and tram lines and not too far from large supermarket, park, and canal boat rides. This was the complete opposite of a stuffy, business hotel. We both felt so comfortable there and would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Took the edge off volcano 2010”
Reviews.Author: GNKsci
Reviews.Content: I was recently a displaced person in Europe trying to get home as a result of the Icelandic volcano in 2010. Not knowing if the airspace would open for my connecting flight, I took the train to Amsterdam and stayed at this lovely hotel. Never having been to Amsterdam, but having travelled Europe, this was the best hotel I've stayed at so far made even better by family hospitality . The rooms are not spartan, but funtional with lots of character. My small single opened up into the yard which was in bloom with tulips and magnolia trees. While there was not an iron in room (typical Europe, why?), I got to iron in the kitchen while the owners made pastry for the day. . Add to these great experiences a fantastic location in the museum district on a quiet side street - not quiet as in boring, but quiet as in away from tram tracks and traffic. i would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean, well-situated hotel, with healthy breakfast & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: JourneyingWoman
Reviews.Content: We will recommend Aalders to family and friends for the following reasons: Well-situated: Quiet street. 1 block to the Van Gogh Museum, 2 to the Rijksmuseum. Around the corner from designer shopping. Easy access to city centre on foot or by tram. Clean hotel and room. Breakfast included was "continental plus": Hardboiled eggs, cold cut meats, cheese, breads and pastries, cereals, yogurt, fruit, juice, hot beverages. Amenities: Free internet access from the lounge and via wi-fi. Elevator. Helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “well-situated and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: bladeandahalf
Reviews.Content: Very well situated for Art Galleries and (if you can afford them) designer shops. Disappointing that the Stadelijke Gallery is still closed but that's not the fault of the hotel! Close to excellent transport links into the city centre, and good restaurants nearby. Try the Sama Sebo (just around the corner) for excellent Indonesian food, but you may need to book Staff at the hotel very friendly and helpful. Our room was small but nicely carpeted and beds were comfortable and there was good linen. (extra pillow would have been nice). As with a most continental hotels, there were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room, but hot drinks could be bought and taken up to our room. (we keep saying that we must bring our travel kettle, teabags and coffee when we go abroad, as we take these for granted in English hotels). A good breakfast with lovely views of the garden at the back of the breakfast room was welcome each day, as was the British TV news! Overall, a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: eire1Norway
Reviews.Content: Hotel Aalders was a pleasent exsperience. The location was perfect - only a few minutes to go to the city center. The room was clean and comfortable.Quiet location. The staff service was excellent. The last night one in our family got ill and needed contact with an doctor - the staff on the hotel were extremely helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly recommend - quiet and well located for museums.”
Reviews.Author: Lolly1968
Reviews.Content: I went with husband and 2 daughters, aged 12 & 10. We had a family room sleeping 4. It was spacious, had TV with BBC channels, and a balcony to sit out on. Free wifi was very useful too. The beds were comfortable, the hotel was quiet. There is a lift for those not able to manage the stairs. Location was excellent for Van Gogh museum and Rijksmuseum and there is a large supermarket close by. But if you want a bit of atmosphere in the evening for your evening meal you will need to take a 10-15 minute walk or a tram. We found the breakfast ample: self-service buffet. We were only there for 2 nights and the breakfast was the same each day which was fine for us but may get repetitive if you are there for several nights. The staff were excellent and very informative, helpful etc. If you are coming from or going to Schiphol airport ask them about the quick way, where you take the no 5 tram to Zuid station then the train to Schiphol. Much quicker than taking tram to Centraal station then train to Schiphol.

Reviews.Title: “nice & cosy hotel with very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MusicfanKortrijk
Reviews.Content: Very clean & comfortable rooms. Quiet area very close to the major museums & the Concertgebouw. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel...Go for it...”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust_Turca
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel from booking.com at a very good price. The hotel was very easy to find, I just took the train from Schiphol Airport to Amsterdam Centraal and hopped onto tram #5. It is located at the Museumplein (Museum District) and a very chic shopping street is just nearby. Upon arrival, the hotel has upgraded our small room to a larger room which was very bright and pretty spacious, at no charge!!! It has a cable TV with English speaking or English subtitled TV channels. They charge â‚¬ 2,50 for the wireless access but the computer on the ground floor is free to use. The breakfast was very satisfactory, the selection of cereals and typical Dutch cheeses were the additional bonuses. The staff was very friendly, they stored our bags at no charge and gave us information about the town. It is located at an extremely safe and elegant part of the city, excellent for a solo female traveler or families with children. The hotel does not have a lift, so pack up light when coming here. It is quiet, comfortable, homey, warm and ideally located...Great value!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, sweet atmosphere & lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: abecedary
Reviews.Content: 1. LOCATION. This hotel is situated on a quiet street, with some other hotels, and right at the end of the block is the Rijksmuseum. If you walk just a little farther, there is the Van Gogh museum. Both are top-notch and the Rijks is a must-see. There is a park on the other side of the block, near the Van Gogh museum, and I saw there was ice-skating going on. Very, very appealing. Restaurants (I recommend Canaleto) as well as luxury-brand stores are also close by. If you cross the canal going towards the center of the city, there are more inviting (that is, less elite) shopping and eating opportunities. In short, the location is ideal -- a 30-minute walk from Amsterdam Centraal and the Anne Frank museum. Not good if you have tons of luggage, I suppose, but I was able to walk all over town with my 3-days worth of clothes, etc. without too much pain. Amsterdam seems planned-out with pedestrians and bicyclists in mind. It was great, and easy to figure out even for a first-timer. 2. SAFETY. I am 22 years old, female, and a solo traveller. It was my first time in The Netherlands, so I was very happy to see I would be completely safe staying at this hotel. You give the front desk your keys whenever you leave, and there is someone there 24/7. They have a camera to see who approaches the entrance, so when you come back, they buzz you in and there your keys are, waiting for you. You are allowed one guest, if you specify whom beforehand (I stayed in the small, single room -- perhaps you get more guests if you are with a larger party, in a larger room?), so nobody comes or goes that they don't know about. There was, however, a door from my room leading outside into a courtyard, which I initially found a little alarming; but I simply locked it and drew the heavy curtain over it at night. 3. VALUE. This was not a very expensive, super-fancy hotel, but it was very professional, and had a very homey feel. They all speak perfect English, of course, and like all the Dutch I met on my trip, they were friendly and kind. My small one-person room was equipped with a television with approximately 20 free channels with a few in English, wardrobe, nightstand/bedside lamp, desk, single bed; the bathroom was likewise very basic. There is a shower but no tub, and a hair-dryer provided. The only soap that you get is from a dispenser on the wall, like at a public toilet -- there is one above the sink and one in the shower to be used on your body AND your hair. This I found slightly unusual, but the only hotels I have ever stayed at before have been in the US. Overall, no big deal. Bring your own stuff if you are fussy. As far as the appearance/layout of the hotel, it is perfectly respectable in every way -- small, but very nice. 4. FOOD. There is a very good breakfast upstairs from 7:30am to 9:00am. You can help yourself to cereals and milk, tea, breads, croissants, eggs, etc. They will offer you coffee as well. Nothing too elaborate, but a very nice dining room and pleasant service. Downstairs is a bar with alcohol, some sodas, and some minimal snacks (candy bars and potato chips). 5. NOISE. If you stay in one of the two downstairs rooms, you will probably hear people thumping on the stairs all hours of the morning. They are slightly steep steps, so this is likely why. However, the neighborhood itself is virtually silent (I stayed in February, so this is based on a winter experience -- it may be different in the summer when more people are on vacation). 6. Was there anything that went wrong with my stay? Well, the pen on my desk was quite useless. The phone in my room was not connected until I mentioned it to the front desk, but they quickly remedied that. Oh, and I started out with two pillows, until one disappeared the next day, which was disappointing, as I like having two pillows to sleep with. In conclusion, I will certainly stay here again. I love Amsterdam and the Hotel Aalders was perfect for my situation.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, nice staff, perfect (family)room”
Reviews.Author: RobMarian
Reviews.Content: We felt very welcome and completely at home here. The location is superb: right in the heart of Amsterdam in a very quiet street. The people at the reception were helpful and friendly. Our (family)room offered perfect value for money. Our 5-year old daughter felt immedialtey comfortable. Just one minor point: a more international breakfast (fresh fruit, omelets, bacon) would be appreciated. But apart from that: we will certainly return to Hotel Aalders and we thank the receptionists for their kindness and assistance! Family Robert Vissers / Verdonk

Reviews.Title: “Well situated hotel in charming quarter of Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: IlkleyDiamonds
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful staff. Other guests friendly and considerate. Family atmosphere (we took 15 yr old son & 11 yrd old daughter). Breakfast served us well - good coffee! Our room was lovely - we had the one with the huge window and balcony. We only had a shower - no bath, which was a bit of a shock, but it was a decent shower. Very clean. Albert Hijn (supermarket) is very close. If you work out how to use the trams(!), the tram stop is very close to the hotel. Line 5 takes you to Central Station with Leidesplein on the way. The hotel is really close to Rijks & Van Gogh and the (seasonal) outdoor skating. (Rijks museum are still charging full rate (about 14 E each) but over half the museum is being refurbished.). Take your laptop and you can login at the hotel - which is quite helpful for airport info etc. This is a really great end of town to base yourself in - the haute coutrure shops are nearby too - albeit for window shopping. This area is a real part of city life - children's schools and playgrounds are integrated all around. I'm so relieved we didn't base ourselves near the central train station which is close to the red light district. Amsterdam is curiously permissive. Everyone seems to be smoking cannabis and sex is, apparently, a commodity.Permissive to everyone that is, except the poor pedestrian, who fears for his life crossing the road. If the bikes don't get you the trams will! The bicycle is king here. And you can hire those too from the hotel.Given the proximity to the Vondel Park that would probably be a great thing to do in the Spring/Summer. Thanks to the staff at the hotel who helped to make it a very pleasant and successful half term stay.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Johnnyableto
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel right longside museum quarter. Very quiet at night. Short walk to most of Amsterdam. Very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, friendly, great location”
Reviews.Author: py0
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and warm, although rather small (but apparently that's de rigour in Amsterdam). Breakfast was good, and the service was friendly and helpful. Free internet and printer usage was a real bonus. Location was great, on a smart street right next to the Van Gogh museum.

Reviews.Title: “quiet & well located”
Reviews.Author: jmiswing
Reviews.Content: a human sized hotel...pleasant staff...a nice place to rest very close to museums and convenient if you want to go to the centre (tram stop at 100m)

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Amsterdam - I felt like at hom”
Reviews.Author: ALBTirana
Reviews.Content: The best hotel I have ever stayed. The staff is so kind and helpful. I was impressed by the early breakfast that was served only for us (six people) in the little bar at the lobby. The gentlemen of the night shift at the reception served the breakfast to us. I was impressed by his kindness. He was like the best grandfather to me.

Reviews.Title: “Large family room”
Reviews.Author: Mike-OWaterloo
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four, and enjoyed the large room. Breakfast was standard European style - bread, cheese, cold cuts, cereal, croissants. Bathroom was fine and clean, there was a pacth on the wall that could have used a touch up, certainly nothing serious. Very little street noise - it seems to be a quiet, residential part of town. Location is excellent for Rijks and van Gogh. Bought discounted cruise tickets, and certainly enjoyed the cruise, which was only a short walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: NeroNewDelhi
Reviews.Content: The Aalders has an outstanding location, literally just a few steps from both the VanGogh and Rijiksmuseums, You can walk to Leidesplein in 10 minutes and to the Jordaan in 20, The personnel working at the Aalders are helpful and friendly. We had a medium size double, which outside Europe would have only been described a miniscule, but for Amsterdam, it was of a decent size. The room was bright, clean, and efficient, with a small outside deck with two chairs (room #10), which would have been great in June perhaps, but of little use in January with snow falling. Breakfast is included and was typical of Europe- bread, cheese, meats, hard boiled eggs, delicious yogurt, granola, toast, juice and coffee or tea-definitely no complaints. The hotel has free wi-fi and if you're without your own computer, there is one for guest use in the lobby. For the price, details, and locations, Aalders is an excellent choice when in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: equemac
Reviews.Content: I was for only one night in Amsterdam, in this hotel. I book this hotel spacially for its location which is close to the main museums of the city. Its location its great, because its very close to the rijskmuseum and Van GoghÂ´s, itÂ´s just five minutes walking. To go to the city centre is very easy by tram nÂº5. it is located, in a very quiet street, but you can find lots of restaurants and bars very close in the square near the hotel. Room wasnÂ´t very big, as usual in most capitals in Europe, but it was clean. The hotel it seems a little bit old, it needs some restoration, but it is very comfortable. I think is very good choice if you want to go to Amsterdam. Its really a worth enough to go. Breakfast was ok, it has everything you want to start, for the day. Bread, toast, pastries, coffe and tea.

Reviews.Title: “very hospitable staff”
Reviews.Author: AHolidayGuy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the edge of the city centre. If you prefer a hotel in a slightly quieter area, then you will like the location. Vondelpark is just around the corner, and there is a nice, busy square where you can eat about 3 minutes walk away. Two trams run to the City Centre from here - the station is literally 2 minutes walk. if however you are a group of young people who want to be out late each night, then you're probably better off staying in a hotel more central. The single room was quite small, as was the shower. Also, the toilet was dirty the first day I got there, but this can be attribute to human error, as it was clean on the other days. The wireless broadband in my room was awful - I was not able to connect for more than a couple of minutes. As an IT professional who needed to do some work in the evenings, this did not go down well. The staff are very friendly - it is a family run business, and they are lovely people. The front desk is manned 24 hours a day. All in all, this is a nice hotel, but it was a bit pricey for my liking.

Reviews.Title: “Charming ~ Family owned and operated ~ Great find”
Reviews.Author: SuperModo
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam can be a loud and hectic destination. Hotel Aalders is in a prime location and is on a QUIET street. It is walking distance from the Van Gogh museum, Heineken Experience, House of Bols, Park, Shopping Etc... The hotel is family owned and operated. Free wifi and their lobby bar has a television and a computer/printer available for guests to use. Full bar with snacks, all reasonably priced. We stayed 3 nights and had 2 guests occupying the small twin room. This suited our needs for a short stay, but would recommend for longer stays a larger room. The room was comfortable and cozy, but small. Our room overlooked a garden and other rooms over look the street out front. Complimentary breakfast is served every morning in a very nice dining room. The breakfast selection included cereal, yogurt, fresh bread, pastries, cheese, and a variety of meats. They have a variety of juices, hot tea, and coffee of course. Do not miss the opportunity to chat with Rick who works in the dining room. He is extremely friendly and courteous. The front desk made restaurant recommendations for us and made the arrangements for a taxi van to the airport. Do not utilize the airport shuttle. They are known for being unreliable and customarily late. The taxi is less expensive and reliable. We had six in our group and it was 40Euro to the airport v. 15Euro per person for the airport shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little spot”
Reviews.Author: explore2299
Reviews.Content: We were in the hotel for 3 days. Myself and my wife. The hotel is in perfect location, near to city center, but quiet and calm Breakfast is nice, nothing excellent though. Staff is very cordial and helpful :) and yes, elevator is a great help, not very common in Europe, Room was comfortable and spacious enough, Price could be a bit lower though

Reviews.Title: “Away from the Hustle and Bustle of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: checkers
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aalders in April over the Queenâ€™s Day holiday and have had a pleasant experience with them. For one, itâ€™s not right smack in the centre of town, but rather in the Museum Quarter which means the surroundings are a lot more quiet and peaceful than if I had chosen to stay in the city area. Except on the night of Queenâ€™s Day, I managed to get relatively good sleep without the need for earplugs. The hotelâ€™s about a 5-10 minute walk to the tram stop, so getting around really wasnâ€™t much of a problem. And its proximity to the Van Gogh Museum was what I thought the best part of it all - given that Iâ€™m an ardent lover of Van Goghâ€™s works! Breakfast was relatively good by European standards. Although itâ€™s pretty much the same stuff every day, at least you get the chance to get some food in the system before you set off on the dayâ€™s adventures â€¦ particularly since food ainâ€™t cheap in Amsterdam. I arrived way before the official check-in time but the receptionist at the front desk was very accommodating and even invited me into the lounge for a free cup of coffee while they got the room ready for me. Love the fact that there is an elevator in the hotel (a rarity for hotels in the city) â€˜coz Iâ€™m not known for travelling light ;-) â€¦ and also love the free internet access available to guests at the bar area. It definitely makes online research while on the go easy and handy.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a quiet area”
Reviews.Author: citroen_ax
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Aalders Hotel with my husband and 2 teenage sons.The staff is friendly and always helped us when we asked for directions. The family room is very big and suited us fine also with a balcony overlooking the main road.The curtains and bedspread are 70s style and need a change. The bathroom is small and has no ventilation .The breakfast was served in an elegant room and we had freshly baked bread,hams,cheese ,danish pastries,hardboiled eggs etc.Quite good.No bacon and fried eggs though.The location of this hotel is perfect .Away from all the hustle and bustle of the centre but only a few steps and you can get trams 2 and 5 and will be in the cenre in a few minutes.The museums are just round the corner.We even managed to walk from the hotel to Central station without realizing how much we walked.FREE INTERNET in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Amsterdam but”
Reviews.Author: R111VVS
Reviews.Content: staff helpful , area quiet and a nice part of the city away from the hustle and sleaze. Easy to get around and near the museums . Helpful with early morning checkout, taxis and pc for online checking. Family room disappointing , very small bathroom and not that clean. Corridors smelt of boiled cabbage . Breakfast nice room but the food was lacking especially buffet service and more than one day and you hankered fo rsomething else.Limited choice. Bar downstairs comfty enough but lacked any atmosphere. Ok budget hotel and you go with that mindset then you will not be disapppointed but we have stayed in much better ( and also far worse). Ok but not inspiring

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little family hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: HMMAuckland
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice small hotel located in a quiet street near the Van Gogh and Rijks musuems, Vondelpark and Leidse Plein. The staff are very friendly and helpful. It is also very close to public transport, Albert Cyup market and a supermarket. The staff were happy to give advice on local sights, look up train schedules and answer any questions.
