I asked for an early check-in and was given my room upon arrival at 8am. The single room was bigger than I expected and the bathroom was modern. The room was cleaaned daily and towels were changed daily too. It was also very handy to have wireless Internet available. Breakfast services was very good too. I would stay in Aalders Hotel again and would recommend it to anybody looking for a small hotel with character and personal service.

Reviews.Title: “I had a very nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: Roadk
Reviews.Content: I booked my small single room last minute. Nice place and very nice staff. Location: excellent! The rooms had all i needed,clean, FREE INTERNET !!!! and the breakfast also included!!! I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tomplay
Reviews.Content: The room is ok and located not too far from the tram station. The buffet breakfast is good but no hot food.

Reviews.Title: “VERY VERY DISAPPOINTED ! NOISY, DUSTY ,TINY”
Reviews.Author: phbalance
Reviews.Content: I was extremely disappointed with Hotel Aalders. We are generally easy going and didn't expect too much but when you pay $175 a night you would think that maybe it would be a comfortable stay ! Far from it. The room was extremely small/bathroom even smaller. The room was so dusty that me and my husband would start sneezing as soon as we enetered the room. Once we stepped out we were fine. The carpet and curtains was probably not vaccumed regularly which explains our sneezing. Just because you use bright red color to decorate the room doesnot make the room plush! We were given a room on the first floor facing the road inspite of our request for a quiet room. We could hear noises from the street -when other guests were leaving in the morning /night we could hear them / we could hear people talking downstairs, hear taxis , cyclists etc, It was awful ! all the rooms seemed packed together in a matchbox building. As for the morning staff- I would not say they were friendly- They gave you information if you asked and thats about it. Only the night attendant was a nice old man who was warm and friendly. There are many other hotels in the same road so please pick something else. This is really really not worth it. Will not recommend this hotel even to my worst enemy. Amsterdam is awesome and we enjoyed our time there- the only downside was Hotel Aalders.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: SquareNothing
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aalders Hotel for 4 nigths at the start of June. Originally we thought that the Hotel might have been a bit far from the centre of Amsterdam, however we where pleased to find that we where wrong, the centre is a short tram ride or a short walk away. The Hotel itself was very clean and with a good sized room, the breakfast was also very nice. If I where to return to Amsterdam I would definetly consider this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “great service, very clean, very quit”
Reviews.Author: nadematsi
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Amsterdam. We stayed in Aalders-Hotel for 4 nights, and we have to say that there is nothing negative about it. Itâ€™s close to everything and most importantly, far from noise. Itâ€™s very-very clean and the staff is always willing to help and answer in all your questions. We will certainly recommend it to all potential visitors. To summon it up, we believe Aalders is the best choice for descent vacations.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: jeanfromthesierra
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Aalders was absolutely wonderful. Fresh baked breads and croissants, meats, cheeses, yogurt, fruit- a substantial, healthy breakfast every morning; clean rooms; friendly employees; a great little bar with computer, an elevator, perfect location. The rooms wee small by American standards, but the prices made this cozy, clean, friendly place an excellent value. The best museums are right down the street and the tram is very close, but we walked almost everywhere. I would go back there again and again if I could.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel & its neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: 9tee9
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed in a quadraple room with a balcony overlooking the front street. It was a big cosy room with clean attached shower & toilet. This is a smoke-free hotel with a lift. The hotel is in a lovely, quiet and safe neighbourhood. Museums, a supermarket, a very nice park, and street full of branded shops are nearby. Albertcupstraat market is about 20 minutes walk in the south east. Amsterdam is not a vast city anyway, so we enjoyed walking to places of interest from the hotel. If one prefers the public transport, the tram stop is only a minute walk away. We loved the buffet breakfast and the breakfast room. We arrived at hotel at 7am in the morning and our room was ready for us. The checking-in process took only a couple of minutes. After more than 2 hours sleep, we recovered from our jet lag and were ready to explore the neighbourhood. We were particularly impressed by the friendliness and efficiency of the hotel staff. We would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trajan99
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel. As you'd expect with a three star hotel - the lounge/bar is fairly small, and there wasn't a safe or fridge in my room. On the other hand, the Hotel Aalders has a nice friendly atmosphere and I had an enjoyable stay there at a very reasonable rate. What I liked most was the polite and helpful staff, the nice Dutch style buffet breakfast, and the location very near the museums. (I had no idea that the Rijksmuseum is basically at the end of the same road as the hotel). Other points of note; The Aalders is in a nice quiet road; there is a good Albert Heijn supermarket five or ten minutes walk away on Van Bearlestraat; and the Connexxion shuttle bus takes you from Schiphol airport - right to the door of the hotel. To conclude: It's not the Ritz - but if you're looking for a nice little family run hotel near Museum Plein at a reasonable price - the Hotel Aalders is just the thing!

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Karlmarie
Reviews.Content: Close to bus lines, museums, and restaurants. Super breakfasts served in a lovely dining room. The staff was very helpful, and went out of their way to print out a list of recommended restaurants and directions to a small town we wanted to visit. They also helped with other information and advice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: aisgb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 2 nights. Make a long story short, I was stuck in Amsterdam for a few nights and had to find a place to stay, so I just walked in the hotel and I was lucky to find a room with Hotel Aalders. The hotel is in a residential area of the city, but very close to everything, museums, parks, shopping area, restaurants, train stops, etc. I felt safe to walk by myself. I stayed different room each day. My first day, I stayed in a small room, however, it was a perfect size for me. As I saw in someoneâ€™s review, you donâ€™t come to Amsterdam to spend too much time in your hotel room, so the size of the room didnâ€™t matter to me. My second day, I moved to a big room. It was too big for me, and I could switch the room with someone else, but again, the size of the room was not a big deal to me. In both room, I felt comfortable. The rooms were very clean and neat. Breakfast was included in price. There was a plenty of great choice. Laundry service was available. The reception was open 24 hours, and the hotel entrance was secured. The receptionist held my luggage after I checked out. I had some errands to do near by, so being able to leave my stuff was super helpful for me. There was a bar/lounge, so I spent some relaxing time and chit-chat with other travelers. There was a free computer available in this lounge, and this made my life so easy. The greatest experience in this hotel was, all of the hotel staffs (including house keepers) were very helpful and friendly. As I mentioned in the front, I was stuck in Amsterdam for the personal reason (lost my passport and couldnâ€™t fly back), so I had no choice but just had to stay there. First it was very difficult for me, and I actually cried for a few times, but I could change my attitude positive, because of the hotel staffs. They were so helpful and warm hearted. They listened to my stories and could comfort me enough. That was what I needed, especially when I felt so alone and nervous and stressed out. I truly felt that they cared about me. Overall, the purpose of my stay wasnâ€™t so great, but staying the hotel was wonderful experience. The price was very reasonable with all services. If you want to stay in an at-home-style of accommodation, Hotel Aalders is the one. I recommend to other people and would love to visit them again.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: nancyb926
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful small hotel in the heart of the Museum district. Public transportation was nearby making it a perfect location to visit to all of the sites in Amsterdam. Airport transportation was easily available and reliable. The hotel staff was pleasant and very helpful, as I was a solo female traveler. Breakfast, which was included in the room rate offered a great selection of high quality food and certainly the BEST coffee that I had in more than 2 weeks of travel through Europe!! Free internet access was a plus. My room was very small and had poor lighting, however the benefits of this hotel more than compensated for these minor disadvantages. I would highly recommed this hotel and would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid and relatively inexpensive Amsterdam choice”
Reviews.Author: ExDancerSeattle
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the other reviews on mid-priced Amsterdam hotels - and finding out that both of the exclusively "gay" options had horrible reviews, I selected Hotel Aalders because it was gay-friendly and had pretty good reviews on this site. I was not disappointed. Here's the highlights: Yes, the rooms are small. If you are visiting Amsterdam and are spending a lot of time in your room, you don't understand the point of travel. The room is small, but it's comfortable for what you need - a place to sleep. I was in Room 1a, which is small but also less expensive. Bed, desk, wardrobe, bathroom, TV, and a window overlooking the back yard. Plus free wifi. That's all I need. There's no A/C, but the window gave a slight breeze and I wasn't uncomfortable (actually a little chilly when I woke up this morning). Yes, the way the shower is set up, you will probably get some water on the floor. Big deal. Make sure you put down the bathmat first. The rooms were very clean and well maintained, as was the whole hotel. They run a class act here. The stairs were steep (that's normal here), but manageable, and they have an elevator, so don't worry. Hotels in Amsterdam are very VERY (did I say "very") expensive. You would pay less for a nicer, large hotel in the US, but that doesn't help if where you want to be is Amsterdam. For the price, this is a good hotel. You can do everything in two days here, so suck it up and deal with the cost. I didn't have the included breakfast - wanted to get out and see the city, so I can't tell you one way or the other. There are plenty of bakeries in the city, so if you don't like the hotel's offering, it's not hard to get a simple breakfast while you are out. That's what I did, because I didn't want to waste a minute. The desk staff were universally nice, helpful, and their English was impeccable. In fact, I was fine everywhere in the city. You hear just about every language on Earth walking around Amsterdam, so everyone uses English as common ground. The desk staff really were wonderful - they helped me find my route back to the airport in the morning, and pointed out on a map all the places I wanted to see. Can't say enough for them. Bottom line, this is a good choice for an inexpensive hotel that's near everything (it is) but not a backpacker's hostel. I'm 46 and it worked out fine for me.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: mar61336
Reviews.Content: hotel aalders was amazing! everything was perfect! the hotel is in the perfect location - right near the van gogh museum and the rijksmuseum. a tram stop is right around the corner which will easily take you to anywhere in amsterdam. the neighborhood is safe and quiet. the hotel staff was unbelievable. they were incredibly helpful with everything. breakfast at the hotel was much better than the typical breakfast served by other european hotels. the beds were so comfortable and the shower was GREAT! i highly recommend hotel aalders! no complaints whatsoever!

Reviews.Title: “A genuinely friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Islander044
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Aalders for ten days recently and believe that I couldn't have made a better choice. For a city as busy and alive as Amsterdam, it was a real bonus to find a friendly hotel in such a quiet location. As I live in a very quiet rural area, this was really important to me. The Aalders is in a residential part of the city, yet very close to everything. A few minutes walk will take you to the Rijksmuseum, van Gogh museum and Concertgebouw in one direction, and Vondel Park and Leidseplein in the other. The trams in Hobbemastraat are just at the top of the street, about 200 yards away. They will take you through the city centre and reach Amsterdam Centraal Station in about ten minutes. My room was advertised as a small single room, but was sufficiently spacious and more than adequate for my needs. You don't come to Amsterdam to spend too much time in your hotel room anyway! It was comfortable, warm and kept scrupulously clean by staff I didn't see - I was never disturbed. The en-suite bathroom and shower were of a reasonable size, and again very clean. Single hotel rooms don't often have the best views, but this room looked out on the garden with its spring flowers and magnolia tree in bloom. Breakfast was buffet style in a large first floor room. There was plenty of choice with cereals, cheese, ham, rolls, fruit, etc. Tea or coffee was provided quickly by friendly staff, who soon learnt that I always have coffee for breakfast. You were neither hurried nor fussed over, making the meal an enjoyable experience. Although the hotel does not provide dinners, I found several restaurants within easy walking distance. The reception is manned 24 hours a day, with the hotel entrance having a buzzer operated security door. It therefore felt really safe. In the bar / lounge there was a computer freely available for guests to check e-mails, etc. I found all the staff courteous, friendly and helpful. They seemed genuinely interested in their guests and were a mine of information. A minor problem with my suitcase on my last morning was instantly solved, much to my relief. It had been many years since I last visited the Netherlands, and I hope to return to Amsterdam and the Hotel Aalders before too long.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant convenient hotel in a quiet neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Mherbert
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a small double room which was a 109 euros per night. It was compact but perfectly adequate with an ensuite bathroom. There are steep stairs but there is a small lift. The hotel reception is staffed 24 hours so you can leave your key at the desk and not have to carry it around. Breakfast is taken in a pleasant room on the first floor and is self-service with croissants, breads, cheeses, juices and tea or coffee. Trams 5 and 2 run past the top of the street and these will take you into the centre or onto Central Station. We purchased a 72 hour pass which was 13.50 euros and we used it a lot. It is just a few minutes walk to the Reichs museum, the Van Gogh museum and the Concertgebouw. There are places to eat and drink a few minutes walk across the park on Franz Hals Street and round the corner on Van Baerle street. We enjoyed the Cafe Vertigo beneath the film museum in Vondel Park, Pompa Cafe on Willemparkweg and old-fashioned Cafe Welling behind the Concertgebouw (avoid if you dislike smoking!)

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet location but needs some minor upgrades”
Reviews.Author: mintey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent quiet location near the Van Gogh museum, a row behind designer shops and 2 minutes walk from the tram into town, but for the price it is a little run down. The room we had was large with a balcony but the decor a bit scruffy. We asked for a quiet room and although not on the road (the had a noisy hum when used when people came in late and got up early. There were no tea and coffee making facilities in the room which is poor for a 3 star. We came in at 11.40 pm one night which is not particularly late and they couldn't even provide coffee from the bar as it was shut and the machine turned off. We had to ask for our coffee trays to be removed when they had been left in the room for 2 days! Breakfast is included in the rate but the choice was limited and we got bored with it after 4 days as the choice isn't great. There are rolls, bread, fruit bread, croissants, ham, cheese, boiled eggs, butter and jams. No fruit salad or grapefruit and the only fresh fruit available were apples. A bit of decor upgrade, tea and coffee in the bedrooms and a better breakfast choice and this hotel would be great. I would probably choose the Bidleberg garden hotel which is opposite next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: chrism00
Reviews.Content: Hotel Aalders was a good place for the price. We made the reservation the day we arrived and got a good rate for a weekend. The hotel is pretty basic but the location is good and it is clean. Bathroom was definitely cosy, but it is Europe. Bed was not especially comfortable but everything seemed clean. We were only there for 2 nites and it served our purposes fine. A good place to stay if you get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Aalders-a pleasant experience!”
Reviews.Author: Lynher
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a tour of Holland and Belgium. Stayed at Hotel Aalders in Amsterdam. Excellent location near museums, good transport links, wide choice of eating places. The room we stayed in was comfortable and adequate with en-suite, but facing the road which was not too noisy. A garden facing room was requested but not available. Good choice of continental breakfast-bread, rolls, croissants, cheese, cold meats, boiled egg, cereals, fruit juices, coffee, tea etc. Staff at front desk were helpful with advice to arrange visits, tours and transport. On the negative side coffee and tea-making facilities in the room were lacking although there was a bar and lounge near the front desk. It was very hot during our stay there and missed having air-conditioning or even a fan to cool us down. I thought the hotel was over-priced given the lack of the above. However, I would be happy to patronize this hotel again. Krish Kumar,Plymouth,UK

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Raippa
Reviews.Content: We had a four-night holiday in the city and spent quite a some time on the web before the trip searching a hotel and reading reviews. My wife then found this one. Location: Excellent on a quiet street with public transport just behind the corner. It takes a 5-minute ride with the tram to the city centre. Staff: Very friendly, professional and helpful. Room: Very comfortable, spacious for even three people. Rather poorly ventilated, however. Made our nights unpleasant because the weather was so hot. Clean room, clean toilet. Odd location of the shampoo dispenser... The room price, too, was above average but acceptable regarding what you receive in return.

Reviews.Title: “aalders great short stay”
Reviews.Author: flyguyamsterdam
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a weekend at the aalders hotel in Amsterdam.the hotel is well situated,not too near the city center but not to far away.the staff are all very friendly and helpful room was clean and serviced daily. Room Could benefit from tea and coffee making facilities.Bathroom small but adequate, but in need of modernization. Breakfast good plenty of choice. Very secure building, and reception available 24hrs.

Reviews.Title: “Aslders Hotel - perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: soi_silom25
Reviews.Content: I was in Amsterdam for business and spent one night at this hotel. The location is perfect; being one street off from the Museum Plein as well as PC-HoofStr., this for me was incredibly convenient. My single room was clean and well maintained, and had a very large window looking onto the back garden. During my checkout, I met the owner, and as I had to get across town to another hotel, he helped me sort out all the logistics & best way to get to my destination. The breafast room for me was abit too small, but the food they served was good. Last year, my wife & I spent a week on holidays in Amsterdam and we stayed at another hotel right on PCHoofStr., I would recommend this hotel over the others on PCHoofStr.

Reviews.Title: “Great for art lovers”
Reviews.Author: CultureVultureCamb
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in March 2007. The hotel was easy to find - especially if you take the connexion taxi from the airport (shared system at flat fare of Eur 12.50 and you are dropped off at the door). I was early but there was no problem with leaving my luggage and being given a local map to help find my way about. The reception desk was always friendly and helpful and because of the security system - you ring the buzzer and are let in - always had my key waiting for me. It is right in the middle of the museum area and a few minutes' walk from the big galleries - hence I was first in to see the Rijksmuseum. I had a small single room which was as advertised. But it had all the facilities you could want and looked out onto the garden and a magnolia just coming into flower. Breakfast was included and met my needs for a short stay. There are places to eat nearby - ideal for a single female traveller - and it is easy to walk to the central attractions too. The rooms are all non smoking which is a big plus in Amsterdam though smoking is allowed in the bar where typically the receptionist was smoking all evening while watching the football - only downside from my point of view. Very friendly and I can't understand the comments of those who found the staff cold. By the way, I met another guest who told me he had stayed there frequently for 20 years but was by no means the longest resident.

Reviews.Title: “We liked the Aalders”
Reviews.Author: ok-59
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, quiet and peaceful, but still close to center, parks and museums. We stayed there about a week, and the only thing that was a bit disappointing was the breakfast that was a bit dull (everyday the same, no vegetables), but coffee was ok. The room (large twin room) was good and clean, with windows facing the garden. Beds were good. Staff was very friendly and helpful, and everything went very well. I recommend, at least for a middle-aged couple like us.

Reviews.Title: “A great friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: nickguitarmusic
Reviews.Content: I've visited Amsterdam on 4 occasions and I always try to book into the Hotel Aalders. I've done the weekend with the boys and the romatic break with the other half. The hotel is situated in the museum quarter close enough to the main attractions but just far enough away from the bustle of the city. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the hotel has an atmosphere not unlike staying 'round someones house. Will be back with the wags in November.

Reviews.Title: “Good for families”
Reviews.Author: SarahJay17
Reviews.Content: Pleasant, clean hotel - quietly situated but well placed for museums and designer shopping. Main trams to centre (Nos 2 and 5) a 2 minute walk away. Some good restaurants nearby. Our non-smoking room on the ground floor was large and comfortable. The staff were pleasant and helpful. There is a small bar on the ground floor in which our 2 daughters were welcome. Breakfast was fine (boiled eggs, meat and cheeses with cereals, crossants, etc). We would stay here again if ever we visit Amsterdam again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with Fab Staff”
Reviews.Author: AgeingRockChick
Reviews.Content: I have never been to Amsterdam before, friends were going and we managed to get on the same flight ,so just needed accomodation. This was in short supply and thoroughly tired, I booked The Aalders because it was available. I wasn't disappointed though. We arrived far too early because Easy Jet cancelled our original flights, but this was no problem - we booked in, left our luggage and took off to familiarise ourselves with the area, which from a female stance was perfect - first left, first right and you have Louis Vuitton, Chanel, La Coste, Burberry and it just goes on and on..... Location-wise it was ideal - right in the heart of Museum Plein and a few minutes by #2 or #5 tram into the city centre (the #5 also takes you to Centraal Station). Jan Luykenstraat architecturally was exactly as I imagined with five storey terraces on a tree- lined street. The hotel itself is charming and comfortable rather than luxurious, with great English speaking staff (my Dutch is slightly worse than my Spanish) and a pretty cheap bar! Ideally situtated for accessing all the cultural sights and sounds, coffee shops, bars and nightlife, it is quiet at night and boasts a lovely breakfast room. I will definitely revisit Amsterdam and when I do, I will be booking the Aalders.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up for Hotel Aalders”
Reviews.Author: Bill_McNie
Reviews.Content: I've just returned to Scotland after spending a week at Hotel Aalders with my family. We were very pleased with the hotel - our family room was clean and well appointed, all of the staff (both at reception and in the breakfast room) were helpful and friendly and the facilities were first rate. The bar was excellent (with drinks available till 2 am for residents), as was the selection of maps and leaflets at reception. The range of food and drinks available at breakfast (bread / eggs / cold meats / cheese etc) time was spot on, and really set us up for the day. We also found the security arrangements in place at the hotel very reassuring (i.e. 24 hour concierge and entrance via a buzzer and video camera surveillance). Overall, I would certainly recommend the hotel to anyone looking for a quiet hotel in the museum area of Amsterdam. It's barely five minutes' walk from the Rijksmuseum etc, and is situated in a very upmarket area that seemed safe and was very quiet at night. The Vondelpark is just round the corner, while the bright lights of Max Euweplein and Leidseplein are just along the road.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, and great service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay for my first trip to Amsterdam. The service was very kind and helpful for a first-timer.

Reviews.Title: “super!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Aalders was an home coming experience!!! Pleasant and helpfull staff..especially Alex...thank you for everything!! The rooms were clean and the location of the hotel was great. Just in the middle of everything...Museums, Restaurants, Public Transport and lots of Shops. This hotel was recommended by friends and we are very greatfull they told us about the hotel Aalders. We will return very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in a family room (room 6): 4 beds with enough floor space left for the kids to do a puzzle, spacious balcony, very small bathroom. The room was clean. The staff were extremely helpful. The hotel has a great location, just a few metres from the Van Gogh museum and the Rijksmuseum, and also just a few metres from a tram and bus stop that takes you to the Leidseplain and the town centre in minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Aalders was the best choice we could have made. Good location, nice hotel with extreme friendly staff. The staff was a big help to reserve several tours for us as explaining where to go in Amsterdam without feeling a tourist!!!! Our room was clean and comfortable with television, telephone and in the bathroom bath, toilet, sink, hair and shower gel and a hairdryer!!! At the hotel bar you could use the internet service at any time. Breakfast was good with different choices and we could come in to the hotel at anytime of the day or night because of the day and night receptionists. We were very happy to stay at the Aalders Hotel and will return for sure to this hotel when we are back in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am one of a group of 4 traveling college students, all female, who traveled to Amsterdam for the weekend. We absolutely loved Hotel Aalders, it was the perfect choice. We stayed in the quad room which had the bathroom in the room. It was clean, big and had a cute balcony off the room. The staff was so friendly and helpful and we felt extremely safe always. I couldn't have asked for a better place, and it is ideal for travelers on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel with artistic surroundings”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is a rare situation to fell yourself like at home in the place you are for the first time. The Hotel Aadlers is a small, cosy hotel with a very kind staff. The hotel is situated in luxurious part of the city - between Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh's museum. This is a place you can relax from a rush within one step distance from it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: julry
Reviews.Content: Hotel Aalders is located one block from the Rijks and Van Gogh museums and two blocks from the Concertgebouw (one of the three best concert halls in the world), on a tree-lined street. The front desk staff are extremely accomodating with all things related to your stay as well as to Amsterdam in general. The hotel is clean and has an elevator to alleviate days worth of climbing those steep Dutch stairs. We stayed in a triple room (three singles, of which two were pushed together as one bed) in a huge room at the front of the building. Because Amsterdam had a warm spell (at least for May), we had to leave the windows open overnight, during which the otherwise silent street was intermittently noisy due to mopeds or revelers coming home. For the majority of the time, though, it was very quiet. The bathroom was small but clean, and the beds were very comfortable. Towels were changed every day. The breakfast was typically European, but filling: cold meat, cheese, hard-boiled egg, assortment of breads, coffee or tea. Be sure to look for the self-service part of the breakfast, which offers a toaster for the bread, cereals, fruit, and other condiments. I must say that the place exceded my expectations for a three-star hotel. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a quiet place to stay that is still close to the city center - and especially to museum/arts buffs. I would stay there on my next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On the upside: This hotel was inexpensive (private room and bathroom for not much more than a hostel). It is well-located in an upscale, quiet part of town and only a few minutes walk from the heart of the city. The staff was pleasant, and the room and bathroom were clean. On the downside: The room was small, and the hotel in general is a bit shabby. Overall, I was quite satisfied and think Hotel Aalders is very good value. I would stay there again... unless I was planning to spend a lot of time in the room, in which case I'd spend a bit more for a little more luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel-Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Lindy1974
Reviews.Content: The Aalders hotel was an excellent base for me and 5 of my girlfriends. We were allocated 2 triple rooms which were fabulous, roomy and spotlessly clean. As you can imagine, we were not the quietest guests which the hotel may have experienced but the staff were great and did not complain at all. I would recommend this hotel to anyone as it is close to Vondelpark, museums, and if you have lots of cash to splash, designer shops such as Gucci, Armani, Lacoste etc, etc. You can jump on a tram 2 minutes from hotel which will take you to Dam Square. Oh and the young guy on reception was rather dishy!!! I would definately go back to this hotel the next time I visit Amsterdam. Excellent!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I can only speak about the room in which I stayed at Hotel Aalders and I don't know how the other rooms compare in this small family-run hotel, but my experience was simply DREADFUL. The staff was friendly, but there was no hot water for morning showers and there was no heat in the room for the first two chilly days (in May). At 82 Euros per night for a single room, some minor comforts should have been provided but were not. This hotel requires a three-night minimum stay! I would have had better accomodations at a local youth hostile! The mattress on the bed was so saggy, old, and lumpy that it was impossible to sleep comfortably. The room itself was dark and dreary. One of the table lamps didn't work and on the second day, the other table lamp was inexplicably removed from the room; leaving only the ceiling fixture to provide harsh lighting. The hair dryer in the bathroom didn't work. The breakfast that was included in the room's price was meager and woefully inadequate. After I stayed at Hotel Aalders for the required three-night booking, I gladly left and checked into a different hotel. I couldn't wait to be out of this dreadful place!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful April vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a terrific location for our first time in Amsterdam as it is very near the museumplein, shopping and the tram. Our room was large and VERY quiet. It is a family run hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. The shower is open (why don't they use shower curtains?) but that is the only thing I could possibly complain about. The breakfast room is beautiful. The breakfast is typically Dutch with meats, cheese and hard boiled egg and breads. There is juice, coffee (wonderful!) as well as yogurt, milk and cereal. You won't go hungry. I would highly recommend this hotel and would gladly stay there again on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “A quiet corner of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Aalders 3/4 times over the past years. We have always found it to be a comfortable, clean, friendly hotel. Its location is just one more plus. Close to restaurants and museums it makes visits to Amsterdam like going home to an old comfortable neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant people”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel,close to the museums. did not have a bad experiance at all, thought that the staff was very friendly. Room where clean and big and the bathroom was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here - It Will Ruin Your Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to stay at Hotel Aalders for 5 nights, but had such a terrible experience we ended up leaving after one night. We had to waste half a day finding somewhere else to stay. It seemed nice enough at first, but then we noticed that our bathroom had a strong smell of sewage. We arrived quite late, so the only person to complain to was the doorman. At first he said he could do nothing, then when we pushed he said we could use a bathroom in an empty room but could not stay in the room. After arguing for awhile we were allowed to stay in another room, though he was very reluctant. The next day we spoke to the manager, and she was cold and not at all understanding. She said the bathroom smelled this way because it was an old city. We said the bathroom in the room we finally stayed in was fine, and she shrugged her shoulders. She would not let us stay in a different room unless we spent close to 50 dollars more per night. When we said we were going to find somewhere else to stay, she said we needed to check out on time, since the room had to be made up. Remember, we had reserved the room for 5 nights so clearly no one else was staying in the room. Overall, for the amount this hotel wants you to pay, it is a TERRIBLE value. The staff is cold and not at all accomidating. STAY AWAY, and you will have a much better vacation.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Aalders
HotelInfo.Address: Jan Luijkenstraat 13-15, Amsterdam 1071 CJ, The Netherlands
